TEXT.P: A major challenge facing policy makers is predicting future changes in atmospheric CO<font size="-4">2</font> concentrations and the resulting climate change.
These predictions start with knowing CO<font size="-4">2</font> emission rates and projecting how they are likely to change in the future.

The year 1990 has been adopted as the conventional "baseline" year against which future changes are measured. The table at the lower left shows the emissions of CO<font size="-4">2</font> in 1990 by various regions of the world. The units are million metric tons (MMT) per year.
